oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Military commission of Lewis T. Morris , Brevet Major, U. S. Army
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Military commission of Lewis T. (aka Louis Thompson) Morris, Brevet Major, U. S. Army, December 16, 1864, "for gallant and meritorious service at the Battle of Nashville, Tennessee," signed by President Andrew Johnson, cosigned by Edwin M. Stanton, Secretary of War.

Louis Thompson Morris served with the 19th Infantry, Indiana, U.S. Army, chiefly with the Army of the West. He received the brevet rank of Captain for service during the Atlanta Campaign, 1864; the brevet rank of Major for meritorious service during the Battle of Nashville, 1864; and the rank of Captain, 19th Infantry, Indiana, in February 1865. He was promoted to Lieutenant Colonel, 1st Cavalry, U.S. Army in 1897. He died in June 1899 and is buried in Arlington National Cemetery, Washington, D.C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Johnson, Andrew, 1808-1875
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Johnson, Andrew, 1808-1875; Stanton, Edwin McMasters, 1814-1869; United States. Army -- Promotions; Nashville, Battle of, Nashville, Tenn., 1864
